goals.question: What is the distribution of car prices?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of car prices and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between car price and horsepower?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of car price vs horsepower
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between car price and horsepower.

goals.question: What is the distribution of car mileage?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the range of car mileage and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the distribution of car body styles?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of car body styles
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the frequency of each car body style in the dataset.

goals.question: What is the relationship between car price and fuel efficiency?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of car price vs fuel efficiency
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is a correlation between car price and fuel efficiency.

code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['price'], bins=20, edgecolor='black')
    plt.xlabel('Price')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of car prices?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['horsepower'], data['price'])
    plt.xlabel('Horsepower')
    plt.ylabel('Price')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between car price and horsepower?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['mileage'], bins=20)
    plt.xlabel('Mileage')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of car mileage?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    body_style_counts = data['body_style'].value_counts()
    body_style_counts.plot(kind='bar')
    plt.xlabel('Body Styles')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of car body styles?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['price'], data['fuel_efficiency'])
    plt.xlabel('Car Price')
    plt.ylabel('Fuel Efficiency')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between car price and fuel efficiency?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
